title: Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe's daughter plans toy shop trip now she's home in UK
text:

The five-year-old daughter of Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe said the first thing she wants to do now she’s home in the UK is visit a toy shop.

Gabriella Zaghari-Ratcliffe joined dad Richard at a press conference in Westminster today, grinning for the cameras and carefully cutting a ‘welcome home’ cake into slices.

Mr Zaghari-Ratcliffe said he had asked Boris Johnson for a meeting since he became Prime Minister, but he had received an answer.

“I will be looking to meet with him as soon as possible, with Gabriella,” he said.

“He obviously when he was foreign secretary tried to solve this issue. He went to Tehran and didn't manage it. Now he's more powerful.

“Now I appreciate he's quite distracted and has got other things going on.

“But actually this is an area where he can really make a difference. We looked to him once before to be our hero, and now he's got another chance.”

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

(Image: PA)

He said it felt like Mr Johnson’s advisors were keeping the Prime Minister “at arms length” from the story.

He said: “Let's be honest, we're a bad news story for the Prime Minister. It might be a good news story one day, but at the moment we're a bad news story.

“So I think his advisors were keeping him away.”

He added: “I would expect a meeting. I've met him before, he was perfectly charming and decent when we met. He made that promise. It's time to deliver on it.”

(Image: PA)

Mr Zaghari Ratcliffe said he’d felt a “turmoil of feelings” over Gabriella’s return home.

He said it was a time for celebration that he had been reunited with his daughter for the first time since his wife’s arrest in Iran three and a half years ago.

But he said he had spoken to Nazanin last night, and she was “really upset.”

He said: “It’s one of the things she didn’t want to happen, for her daughter to leave and her still be stuck in prison.”

(Image: REUTERS)

(Image: PA)

But he added: “Of course, seeing her late last night was lovely. And bless her, she’s a bit shy and a bit traumatised and hasn’t seen daddy for a long time.

“And there is a language problem. So it takes her a while to feel safe. But it’s just lovely to have her back.

Gesturing to the next room, where his daughter was waiting, he said: “We were just negotiating what she wants to do this afternoon, and we went through various different options, and a toy shop was the one that landed. So a toy shop is where we’re off to.”

Moments later there were gasps as Gabriella walked into the room, holding a cake.

(Image: PA)

The five-year-old's parents made the painful decision to bring her back from Iran so she can start school.

Mr Zaghari-Ratcliffe said they were still deciding which school she would be going to, but it would be one near to their home.

And he said he wanted her to start school as soon as possible - maybe as soon as half-term, so they could become less of a “TV family”.
description: Richard Ratcliffe said he has asked for a meeting with Boris Johnson now five-year-old Gabriella has come back to go to school - but hasn't had a reply
